revised_title: A Comparative Study of Respiration in Myriapods
tldr: The author examines the unique respiratory system of Myriapods, specifically Scutigerids, which involves a series of organs with tubes that aerate the blood before it returns to the heart. This mode of respiration is compared to tracheae in other Myriapods and lungs in Spiders and Scorpions, suggesting an evolutionary relationship between these respiratory systems.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy and Physiology
